page.title: 05Cranford Park
page.content: The park once belonged to the old house owned by the Berkeleys.The Astons sold it to the Berkeleys and they lived in it until fifty years ago but then it became a ruin.All that is left are the stables at the back of the church.The park has a wall round it which is over 200 years old.Now the M4 motorway goes through part of it. The park was the Berkeleys garden and groups of gardeners planted trees. They looked after it but it has grown wild now.The River Crane flows through the park.It has many kinds of deciduo- us and evergreen trees.Such as Oak,Ash Sycamore,Hornbeam,Copperbeach,Poplar Horsechestnut,Silver Birch,Yew,Pine and Laurel. There are also some Elm saplings which are quite rare because most of the Elms were wiped out by Dutch Elm disease.
